0: Sen. John McCain (R-Ariz.) explained his endorsement of Mitt Romney in an interview aired Sunday, saying his once-bitter 2008 rival worked tirelessly for his general election campaign. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "After the 2008 [primary] campaign was over, no one worked harder on behalf of my campaign than Mitt Romney did," McCain said on CBS' "Face the Nation." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR McCain likened his 2008 rivalry with Romney with Presidents Ronald Reagan and George H.W. Bush, who ran against each other in the 1980 GOP primaries. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "You can run clips of Reagan and Bush back in 1980 â€” you would get the same thing. These are spirited discussions and debates," McCain said. "You put these things aside just the way Reagan and Bush did" NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "I think by far, he is the best qualified," McCain said. "I admire him, I admire his family, I admire his values."
